summary: This bill, the Iran Sanctions Relief Review Act of 2025, mandates congressional review of presidential actions relating to sanctions on Iran.  The President must submit reports to Congress before terminating or waiving sanctions or taking licensing actions that significantly alter US foreign policy regarding Iran.  It outlines procedures for congressional review, including hearings and potential joint resolutions of approval or disapproval, influencing the timeline of presidential actions related to sanctions. The bill defines the legislative process, committee roles, and timelines for both houses of Congress.
